revised_title: On the Pathogeny of Variola Ovina and its Relation to Smallpox
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to investigate the similarities between variola ovina (sheep smallpox) and human smallpox. They found that the two diseases have a similar pathogeny and that fresh lymph contains spheroidal bodies, which are in organic continuity with micrococci. This study contributes to our understanding of the infective process and the pathology of smallpox.
